name: Conservice - Digital Transformation for Utility Industry Leader
description: Digital transformation initiative for a leading utility management and billing company serving multifamily and single-family properties, commercial businesses, and student housing with comprehensive utility management solutions through cloud-first data platform modernization.
challenge: Legacy systems with multi-family platform retrofitted for single family business causing IT system inefficacy. Scattered client communication across multiple manual channels leading to low client satisfaction. Heavy reliance on basic office tools for critical business functions causing substantial process overheads. Monolithic platforms limiting automation capabilities with labor-intensive processes. Data not served specific to context with knowledge spread thin degrading user experience and productivity. Lack of robust audit trails and process metrics leading to process bottlenecks.
solution: Implemented modern cloud-based technologies with flexible, service-oriented architecture to dramatically improve operational efficiency, enhance user experience, and create a scalable platform capable of supporting multiple business lines. Developed cloud-first data platform with dynamic data ingestion from ERP, NetSuite, and Salesforce. Built data lake storage with Synapse dedicated SQL pool for MPP EDW, self-service end user BI using Power BI Solutions, machine learning algorithms for financial forecasting, and data sharing capabilities with external parties.
outcomes: Business scalability improved by up to 45%
Created scalable platform supporting multiple business lines
Consolidated all inbound and outbound payments
Improved data management and business agility positioning client as leader in utility management industry
teamSize: Cross-functional modernization team including cloud architects, data engineers, and business analysts
